definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash

sentences.english: Instead, they watch pirated DVDs or surf the Web.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之，他們看盜版光碟或者在網上衝浪。

sentences.english: Surfing the Qiantang tides is an age-old tradition in Zhejiang Province.
sentences.chinese: 在錢塘潮上衝浪在浙江省是一種古老的傳統。

sentences.english: In addition, the vehicle essentially surfs on the supersonic shock wave it creates.
sentences.chinese: 此外，車輛基本上是衝浪的超音速衝擊波它創建。
我們能借一個衝浪板嗎？

sentences.english: We understand the future belongs to those who can metaphorically surf.
sentences.chinese: 我們懂得未來將屬於那些能夠衝浪的人。

sentences.english: But serving a new sport means cutting back on his traditional surf stores.
sentences.chinese: 但是，爲一項新的運動方式削減他的傳統衝浪店。

sentences.english: The two coasts in the north have the advantages of being popular for surfing and eco-tours.
sentences.chinese: 北部的兩個海岸擁有衝浪勝地及生態之旅的活動優勢。

sentences.english: Now he surfs three or four times a week.
sentences.chinese: 現在他每週都去衝浪三四次。

sentences.english: A-I've always wanted to surf, but I was never really good at it.
sentences.chinese: 我總是想去衝浪，但是我並不太擅長。

sentences.english: He surfs on the Internet every day.
Then, the wave catches the surfboard and pulls it and the surfer toward the shore.
sentences.chinese: 接著大浪會湧向滑板，將滑板與衝浪者推往海岸。

sentences.english: The challenge is to control both kite and board. A kite is unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 想要同時控制風箏和衝浪板是一件很有挑戰性的事。

sentences.english: Driving time could be given over to working, snoozing or browsing the web.
sentences.chinese: 開車的時間可以用於工作，打盹或上網衝浪。

sentences.english: It was surfing and flow states that brought me back to health.
sentences.chinese: 正是衝浪和心流狀態讓我恢復了健康。

sentences.english: Serious surfers are much stronger and thinner than beach boys.
sentences.chinese: 衝浪運動員要比沙灘小夥兒強壯得多，瘦得多。

definition: Lüdao or Lutao township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
to fish (with line and hook)/to dupe
Saigon, capital of former South Vietnam/Sai Kung town in New Territories, Hong Kong
to dive/to go under water/(in an online forum) to lurk
to amuse oneself/to have fun/to go sightseeing/to take a stroll
to dawdle/to go slow deliberately/to fizzle out/to have all one's hopes dashed/(Tw) to have a soak in a hot spring
